CM Yogi Adityanath Bans Mobile Phone In UP Colleges And Universities, Not Even Teachers Can Use It

CM Yogi Adityanath Bans Mobile Phone In UP Colleges And Universities, Not Even Teachers Can Use It

In a move that is surely going to get brickbats, the Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has banned the use of mobile phones in colleges and universities in the state. A circular to this effect has been issued by the Directorate of Higher Education in Uttar Pradesh. The circular mentions a blanket ban on the use of mobile phones inside universities and colleges.

Students will no longer be allowed to take or use mobile phones inside universities and colleges. The ban is also applicable to teachers across all universities and colleges in the state.

The ban on the use of mobile phones is also applicable to teaching faculty of all UP universities and colleges. The Directorate of Higher Education issued the circular to ensure a 'better teaching environment for students across all colleges and universities in the state'.

representational image

The government observed that a large number of students and teachers were spending their valuable time on mobile phones during the college hours. It may be noted that Yogi Adityanath has already banned the use of mobile phones during his official meetings, including Cabinet meetings.

The decision was taken after some ministers and officers were found to be busy reading messages on WhatsApp during important meetings.

Recently, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has asked ministers to start paying their own income tax. Their share is shelled out by the state government under the Uttar Pradesh Ministers' Salaries, Allowances and Miscellaneous Act, 1981.

Earlier that day, after a newspaper report made the revelation, several politicians said they were not even aware of the provision in the UP Act.
